unstoppable is the perfect title for a

csx8888 train narrowly clears the sharp

unlike mission impossible there was no

in unstoppable denzel washington plays
frank barnes a veteran railroad engineer
who risked his life to stop the train
assisted by a young conductor named will
coulson played by chris pine barnes and
coulson anticipate the stanton curve
implementing the independent air brake
and reducing speed just enough to keep
the train from flying off the track
scott insisted on using real locomotives
borrowing from the canadian pacific
railway wheeling and lake erie railway
and the southwest pennsylvania railroad
for the stanton curve sequence where the
train tilts on two wheels some cg was
required and the surrounding fuel tanks
were added with vfx to raise the stakes
scott's dedication to authenticity
earned him critical praise with roger
ebert calling the film superb and the
new york times writing that scott
creates an unexpectedly rich world of
chugging rushing trains slicing across
equally beautiful industrial and natural
landscapes sadly this would be the last
film scott would direct before his death
in 2012 but it proved to be a profound
bookend to an unstoppable career
